options.label: C
options.text: A type of brain imaging technique used to study face detection.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of evolutionary advantage that allows for quick processing of visual input.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It leads to the perception of illusory faces.

options.text: It is not important for social interaction and understanding.

options.label: C
options.text: The brain's regions responsible for face detection are not related to face detection.

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: It allows for quick processing of visual input.

options.label: B
options.text: It enables face detection faster than other visual stimuli.

options.label: C
options.text: It leads to the perception of illusory faces.

options.label: C
options.text: To track changes in brain activity at the scale of milliseconds.
